thread.title: No charges for Walter Palmer who killed Cecil the lion
thread.title_full: No charges for Walter Palmer who killed Cecil the lion | Examiner.com

author: Cheryl Hanna
title: No charges for Walter Palmer who killed Cecil the lion
text:
No charges Facebook Walter Palmer, the infamous Minnesota dentist who shot and killed Cecil the lion in Zimbabwe earlier this summer, has been cleared of any wrongdoing, reports BBC.com. on Monday afternoon.
According to the Zimbabwe's Environment Minister Oppah Muchinguri, Palmer's "papers were in order." and he broke no laws when he killed Cecil with a bow and arrow. Mrs Muchinguri stated the department would now review how hunting licenses are issued. "We approached the police and then the Prosecutor General, and it turned out that [Walter] Palmer came to Zimbabwe because all the papers were in order," Mrs Muchinguru stated. Palmer's guide, Zimbabwean Theo Bronkhurst's trial is expected to continue on Tuesday; he denies the charge of "failing to prevent an illegal hunt."
After taking two months off from his dental practice, Palmer resumed work in September . He is believed to have paid $50,000 to hunt and kill the lion. Dr. Walter Palmer, 55, stated: "I have a lot of staff members, and I'm a little heartbroken at the disruption in their lives. And I'm a health professional. I need to get back to my staff and my patients, and they want me back. That's why I'm back ." Palmer insists he hasn't been in hiding, but said he had been keeping a "low profile" for security reasons.
And perhaps the most sickening part of the news comes after Palmer refused to answer what has become of Cecil's body. Public condemnation for the death of Cecil still has tempers running hot and disgust on any measured meter hitting the top of the thermometer. Rest in peace Cecil. The world does miss you.
Follow the National Pet Rescue Examiner on Facebook.
